intro: Fimbristylis monostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, linear leaves and a dense cluster of small, spike-like inflorescences. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wetland environments such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread vegetatively, making it a common component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
